Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: black band above black-figure decoration consisting of bird to right, looking back (lower body and feet missing; added red dots on head, neck and wing and added white dots on wing); to right, part of undetermined decoration, possibly a floral.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 61, pl. 50, no. 217)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.284) (phase 3)
